result.markdown:
--- title: "Exploratory Data Analysis: World Development Indicators" author: "Emma Jinright" date: "02-26-2025" format: revealjs: theme: dracula transition: fade scrollable: true bibliography: references.bib --- # Introduction ## World Development Indicators This exploratory data analysis focuses on analyzing a few of the variables from the **World Development Indicators** dataset for 2022 made available by the World Bank [@worldbank]. ## Variables There are 14 variables: :::{.columns} :::{.column width="50%"} - `country` - `inflation_rate` - `exports_gdp_share` - `gdp_growth_rate` - `gdp_per_capita` - `adult_literacy_rate` - `total_population` ::: :::{.column width="50%"} - `education_expenditure_gdp_share` - `measles_immunisation_rate` - `health_expenditure_gpd_share` - `income_inequality` - `unemployment_rate` - `life_expectancy` - `primary_school_enrolment_rate` ::: ::: ## Focus Variables I will be focusing on :::{.incremental} - **`total_population`** - **`life_expectancy`** - **`measles_immunisation_rate`** ::: # Exploratory Data Analysis # Total Population ## Average Population per Country ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | Average Population | Population Standard Deviation | |:------------------:|:-----------------------------:| | 36,536,448 | 141,058,262 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Largest Populations in 2022 | Country | Population | |:-------------:|:-------------:| | India | 1,417,173,173 | | China | 1,412,175,000 | | United States | 333,271,411 | | Indonesia | 275,501,339 | | Pakistan | 235,824,862 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Smallest Populations in 2022 | Country | Population | |:------------------------:|:----------:| | Tuvalu | 11,312 | | Nauru | 12,668 | | Palau | 18,055 | | British Virgin Islands | 31,305 | | St. Martin (French part) | 31,791 | ::: ::: # Life Expectancy ## Average Life Expectancy per Country ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | Average Life Expectancy | Life Expectancy Standard Deviation | |:-----------------------:|:----------------------------------:| | 72.42 | 7.71 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Highest Life Expectancies in 2022 | Country | Life Expectancy | |:--------------------:|:---------------:| | Macao SAR, China | 85.38 | | Liechtenstein | 84.32 | | Japan | 84.00 | | Hong Kong SAR, China | 83.66 | | French Polynesia | 83.55 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Lowest Life Expectancies in 2022 | Country | Life Expectancy | |:------------------------:|:---------------:| | Chad | 53.00 | | Lesotho | 53.04 | | Nigeria | 53.63 | | Central African Republic | 54.48 | | South Sudan | 55.57 | ::: ::: # Measles Immunization Rate This variable represents the **percentage of the population age 12 to 23 months that is vaccinated against measles** [@CDCmeasles]. ## Average Immunization Rate per Country in Percentages ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | Average Immunization Rate | Immunization Rate Standard Deviation | |:-------------------------:|:------------------------------------:| | 83.85 | 16 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Highest Percentage of Measles Immunization in 2022 | Country | Percent Immunization for Measles | |:-------------------:|:--------------------------------:| | Antigua and Barbuda | 99 | | Bahrain | 99 | | China | 99 | | Cuba | 99 | | Fiji | 99 | ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Countries with the Lowest Percentage of Measles Immunization in 2022 | Country | Percent Immunization for Measles | |:-------------------------:|:--------------------------------:| | Korea, Dem. People's Rep. | 0 | | Montenegro | 33 | | Angola | 37 | | Central African Republic | 41 | | Syrian Arab Republic | 41 | ::: ::: ## Measles Protection According to the United States' Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a vaccination rate of 95% of both doses of the measles vaccine means that the population is protected from outbreaks. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | Number of Countries | Number of Countries with Measles Immunization Rates At or Above 95% | Percentage of Countries with Measles Immunization Rates At or Above 95% | |:-------------------:|:-------------------------------------------------------------------:|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------:| | 193 | 65 | 33.68 | ::: ::: # Figures & Tables ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![This is a bar graph displaying the total population for each country in the top 15% of populations by measles immunization rate (Source: @worldbank).](Presentation_files/figure-revealjs/fig-pop-1.png){#fig-pop width=960} ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![This is a bar graph displaying the life expectancy for each country in the top 15% of populations by measles immunization rate (Source: @worldbank).](Presentation_files/figure-revealjs/fig-life-1.png){#fig-life width=960} ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![This is a scatter plot showing the relationship between total population and life expectancy by measles immunization rate (Source: @worldbank).](Presentation_files/figure-revealjs/fig-scatter-1.png){#fig-scatter width=960} ::: ::: ## ::: {#tbl-overview .cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Population and Life Expectancy of Countries by Protection Against Measles
Is the Population Protected Against Measles? Average Population Population Standard Deviation Average Life Expectancy Life Expectancy Standard Deviation
Protected 67,689,380 248,669,884 76.32 5.26
Unprotected 28,959,171 53,609,898 69.27 7.51
````` ::: ::: # Conclusions ## - Good overview of statistics surrounding total population, life expectancy, and measles immunization rates for countries in 2022 - Future Steps: - Regression Analysis to determine the significance of relationships described above ## References

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
